intro: Myriactis wightii var. cordata, commonly known as the cordate myriactis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide range of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its distinctive cordate (heart-shaped) leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
